5.description: Revealed to be Isildur's heir and the rightful king of Gondor and Arnor. Called Elessar by Galadriel, he carries the sword Andúril, reforged from the shards of Narsil. Leads the hunt for the captured hobbits with grim determination.
Continues to track the Uruk-hai with his keen elven senses, reading signs in the earth and air that others cannot detect. His friendship with Gimli deepens through their shared trials.
Despite his shorter legs, keeps pace with his companions in the pursuit of the Uruk-hai. His friendship with Legolas continues to grow, overcoming ancient prejudices between Elves and Dwarves.

11.description: Travels with Sam toward Mordor, bearing the increasing burden of the Ring. The Ring's weight grows heavier both physically and spiritually as they near the land of its creation.
Remains utterly devoted to Frodo despite the growing dangers and his master's increasing burden. His practical nature and loyalty provide strength when Frodo begins to falter.

Captured by Frodo and Sam while following them. Swears by the Ring to guide them to Mordor, though his true intentions remain suspect. Shows signs of his original Sméagol personality alongside his corrupted Gollum side.

5.description: Returns transformed as Gandalf the White after his battle with the Balrog. More powerful than before, he has taken Saruman's place as head of the White Council. His mission is clearer and more urgent.

relationships.Saruman: Has replaced as head of order

4.description: Captured along with Merry by Uruk-hai after Boromir's death. Shows resourcefulness by dropping his elven brooch as a sign for potential rescuers. Endures the harsh treatment of his captors.
Captured with Pippin by Uruk-hai. Shows quick thinking and courage despite their dire situation. Works with Pippin to leave signs for their friends and seeks opportunities for escape.

3.description: Revealed as a traitor who has turned to darkness. Once the head of the White Council, he now seeks the Ring for himself. Commands vast armies of Uruk-hai from his stronghold of Isengard.

4.description: An Ent, one of the ancient Tree-shepherds of Middle-earth. Tall as a tree himself, with bark-like skin and leaves in his hair. Speaks slowly and deliberately, as Ents measure time differently than the 'hasty' younger races.

2.description: A Marshal of Rohan who leads a company of Riders pursuing the Uruk-hai. Nephew to King Théoden, he is tall and stern with a spear and shield. His éored destroyed the orc-band but found no hobbits among the slain.

6.description: King of Rohan, fallen under the influence of his counselor Wormtongue and seeming old and frail beyond his years. Gandalf breaks the spell upon him, restoring his strength and will to fight.
Théoden's counselor who has been poisoning the king's mind with lies and doubt. Pale and cringing, with a wheedling voice. Revealed to be Saruman's spy within Edoras, weakening Rohan from within.

1.description: Dies valiantly defending Merry and Pippin from the Uruk-hai, though he cannot prevent their capture. His final act redeems his earlier attempt to take the Ring from Frodo.

16.description: The Lady of Lothlórien, one of the mightiest of the Eldar in Middle-earth. Keeper of Nenya, one of the Three Rings of the Elves. Her wisdom and power are renowned throughout the land.
Lord of Lothlórien and consort to Galadriel. An Elf-lord of great wisdom and nobility, ruling the Golden Wood alongside his lady.

14.description: Captain of the Rangers of Ithilien and younger son of Denethor. Unlike his brother Boromir, he is not tempted by the Ring's power. Wise and noble, with a deep love for his homeland.
One of Faramir's Rangers of Ithilien. A skilled woodsman who helps capture Frodo and Sam, bringing them to the hidden base at Henneth Annûn.
One of Faramir's trusted Rangers of Ithilien. A loyal soldier of Gondor who serves in the dangerous border lands, watching for enemies from Mordor.

15.description: A Ranger of Ithilien stationed at Henneth Annûn. Guards the hidden waterfall entrance and maintains watch over the secret base.

9.description: Lord of Westfold who arrives with Gandalf and reinforcements at dawn to break the siege of Helm's Deep. His timely arrival helps route Saruman's army.

relationships.Rohan: Lord and defender of western lands

7.description: An old warrior of Rohan who serves as one of Théoden's trusted captains. Helps organize the defense of Helm's Deep with his experience in warfare.

6.description: The doorward of Théoden's hall, responsible for the king's safety. Shows wisdom in allowing Gandalf to keep his staff, recognizing the wizard's true nature.

3.description: A large Uruk-hai who leads the band that captured Merry and Pippin. Serves Saruman directly and fights with other orcs over the hobbits' fate. Killed by Éomer's riders.
An orc from Mordor who travels with Uglúk's band. Suspicious that the hobbits carry something valuable for his master Sauron. Conflicts with Uglúk over orders.

4.description: A younger Ent who is 'hasty' by Ent standards. More quick to anger than other Ents, especially about the destruction of trees. Joins the attack on Isengard.

5.description: The chief of the Mearas, the great horses of Rohan. Silver-grey and incredibly swift, he bears Gandalf and understands speech. No rider save Gandalf can master him.

21.description: An enormous spider that dwells in the tunnel of Torech Ungol. Ancient and evil, she feeds on all living things that enter her domain. Gollum plans to feed the hobbits to her.

relationships.Gollum: Used by as trap for hobbits

14.description: The Ruling Steward of Gondor and father of Boromir and Faramir. A proud and stern ruler who bears the burden of defending Gondor against Mordor's growing power.

6.description: Niece of King Théoden and sister to Éomer. A lady of Rohan with the heart of a warrior, she tends to her uncle during his weakness and despairs at being left behind when the men ride to war.

8.description: A march-warden of Lothlórien who arrives at Helm's Deep with a company of Elven archers to aid in the defense. His presence shows the alliance between Elves and Men.

13.description: A Black Númenórean who serves as Sauron's messenger and lieutenant. Guards the Black Gate of Mordor with fell power and speaks for his master to all who would enter.

16.description: One of the Istari wizards, focused on beasts and birds rather than the affairs of Men and Elves. Lives in Rhosgobel and aids Gandalf by sending messages through his animal friends.
Ancient king of Gondor and Arnor who cut the One Ring from Sauron's hand but failed to destroy it. His line continues through Aragorn, the rightful heir to both kingdoms.
The Lord of Rivendell and keeper of Vilya, mightiest of the Three Rings of the Elves. Master of healing and lore, he has guided the defense against darkness for ages.
Daughter of Elrond and beloved of Aragorn. Called Undómiel (Evenstar) for her beauty. Her love gives Aragorn hope and purpose in his quest to reclaim his throne.

6.description: A great horse of Rohan given to Aragorn by King Théoden. Swift and strong, he serves faithfully as Aragorn's mount during the journey to Helm's Deep and beyond.

7.description: An ancient king of Rohan remembered in the songs and histories of the Rohirrim. His name is invoked during discussions of the royal lineage and the glory of the Mark.

6.description: The first king of Rohan who led the Éothéod from the north and founded the kingdom. Ancestor of Théoden and all the kings of the Mark. His name is honored in the great hall of Edoras.
Father of Théoden and former king of Rohan. Remembered as a wise ruler who maintained the strength of the Mark before passing the crown to his son.
Mother of Théoden and queen of Rohan. Remembered fondly in the halls of Edoras for her grace and wisdom during her reign beside King Thengel.
Son of King Théoden and heir to the throne of Rohan. The Second Marshal of the Mark who died defending the Fords of Isen against Saruman's forces. His death weighs heavily on the king.

relationships.Rohan: Lost heir to the throne of

19.description: A young rider of Rohan who seems smaller and slighter than the other warriors. Rides with the Rohirrim but keeps their identity hidden beneath helm and armor.

16.description: The banner-bearer of King Théoden who carries the standard of Rohan into battle. A trusted warrior who rides close to the king during the muster of the Rohirrim.

7.description: A marshal of Rohan who fought at the Fords of Isen and later defended Helm's Deep. A veteran warrior loyal to the crown and skilled in battle.

16.description: A marshal of the Mark who leads an éored of Rohirrim. Commands the loyalty of his riders and serves faithfully in the defense of Rohan and its allies.

19.description: A chieftain of Harrowdale who leads men of the mountain valleys. Tall and grim, he knows the ancient paths and the legends of the Paths of the Dead.

7.description: A young rider of Rohan who fights bravely at Helm's Deep. Quick and eager in battle, he represents the courage of Rohan's youth defending their homeland.
A veteran rider of Rohan who stands with his king at Helm's Deep. Experienced in warfare and loyal to the crown, he helps organize the defense of the fortress.
A rider of Rohan who fights at Helm's Deep alongside his brothers-in-arms. Shows the steadfast courage typical of the horse-lords in defense of their people.
A rider who brings word to King Théoden of the enemy's approach. Swift and reliable as a messenger, he demonstrates the communication network of the Rohirrim.

16.description: A scout and rider of Rohan who serves as guide and messenger for the king's forces. Knows the lands well and can read the signs of the countryside.

8.description: A rider who fights at Helm's Deep, showing the determination and skill of Rohan's warriors. Stands firm against overwhelming odds in defense of his people.

19.description: Chief of King Théoden's knights and one of his most trusted warriors. Rides in the king's guard and commands great respect among the Rohirrim for his skill and loyalty.

7.description: An ancient king of Rohan for whom Helm's Deep is named. Famous for his great strength and for defending the fortress during the Long Winter. His horn still echoes in the Deep.

4.description: An Ent who has grown weary and tree-like, dwelling near the mountains. His skin has become more bark-like than the other Ents, and he moves slowly even by Ent standards.
An Ent who has become very tree-like and sleepy, rarely moving from his chosen spot. One of the eldest Ents who remembers the early days of the forest.

10.description: An Ent who participates in the attack on Isengard. Shows the fierce anger of the Ents when roused to wrath against those who destroy the forests.

4.description: One of the oldest Ents mentioned by Treebeard, who has grown sleepy and tree-like. Represents the ancient nature of the Ents and their deep connection to the forest.
An Ent whose skin has grown bark-like over the long years. One of those mentioned by Treebeard as growing more tree-like and less mobile with age.

3.description: A smaller orc in Uglúk's band who scouts ahead and carries messages. Shows the hierarchy and organization within orc forces.
An orc in the band that captured the hobbits. Shows the cruel nature and infighting common among Saruman's orc forces.
An Uruk-hai tracker who helps pursue and capture the hobbits. Demonstrates the tracking skills and organization of Saruman's elite orc forces.

4.description: An orc leader who brings reinforcements from Isengard. Shows the continued organization and support network of Saruman's forces even during the pursuit.

8.description: A captain leading Uruk-hai forces in the assault on Helm's Deep. Commands battalions of Saruman's army with tactical knowledge and fierce determination.
A massive Uruk-hai who carries the torch to ignite the explosive device at Helm's Deep. Shows the specialized roles and fanatical dedication of Saruman's forces.
A captain commanding crossbow units in Saruman's army at Helm's Deep. Shows the tactical organization and siege warfare knowledge of the Uruk-hai forces.

1.description: The first and largest of Saruman's Uruk-hai, created in the pits of Isengard. A massive warrior who leads the attack that results in Boromir's death and the hobbits' capture.

relationships.Saruman: First creation of the White Wizard
relationships.Uruk-hai: First and mightiest of the breed

8.description: A general commanding orc forces at Helm's Deep. Shows the military hierarchy and command structure within Saruman's army during major battles.

7.description: An orc who rides a warg and leads scouts for Saruman's forces. Demonstrates the mobility and scouting capabilities of the enemy's cavalry units.
The largest and most fierce of the wargs serving Saruman. Leads the pack in attacks against the Rohirrim and shows the savage alliance between orcs and wolves.

relationships.Orcs: Mount and ally of orc riders

14.description: A guard of Gondor who serves at the borders of Ithilien. Shows the vigilance and dedication of Gondor's border defenders in watching for enemies from Mordor.

15.description: A man of Gondor mentioned among those who serve in the defense of the realm. Represents the common folk of Gondor who stand ready to defend their homeland.

20.description: A chieftain who leads men from the Blackroot Vale. Commands warriors from the southern fiefs of Gondor in defense of the realm.
Lord of Lossarnach who brings reinforcements to aid Gondor. A stout and reliable lord who commands the loyalty of his people in the southern lands.
A lord who commands men from the Green Hills of Pinnath Gelin. Brings archers and spearmen to aid in the defense of Minas Tirith.
A lord from the coastal region of Anfalas who brings reinforcements. Commands seasoned warriors familiar with defending Gondor's western shores.

15.description: A Ranger who guards the secret base of Henneth Annûn. Maintains watch over the hidden waterfall entrance and protects the refuge of Faramir's company.

14.description: A Ranger of Ithilien who serves under Faramir's command. Skilled in woodcraft and border patrol, he helps maintain Gondor's watch against Mordor's forces.
A Ranger serving with Faramir's company in Ithilien. Not to be confused with the hobbit, he is a man of Gondor who helps patrol the dangerous borderlands.

19.description: A Guard of the Citadel in Minas Tirith mentioned in connection with the defenses of Gondor. Represents the stalwart defenders of the white city.
A young boy of Minas Tirith, son of one of the guards. Represents the children and families that the defenders of Gondor fight to protect.

20.description: An elderly woman of Gondor who serves in the Houses of Healing. Knowledgeable in herb-lore and the care of the wounded, she represents the wisdom of common folk.
Prince of Dol Amroth and kinsman to Denethor. A noble lord who brings Swan Knights and reinforcements from the southern fiefs to aid in Gondor's defense.
A lord from Lamedon who brings reinforcements to aid Gondor. Commands men from the hill country and shows the loyalty of Gondor's southern vassals.

14.description: A Ranger serving in Faramir's company in the dangerous borderlands of Ithilien. Skilled in woodcraft and the ways of stealth required for border patrol.

21.description: Captain of the orc-tower of Cirith Ungol who guards the secret passage into Mordor. A large orc who commands the garrison watching over Shelob's tunnel.
An orc from Minas Morgul who patrols near Cirith Ungol. Shows the overlap of orc territories and the competition between different orc factions in Mordor.

relationships.Minas Morgul: Orc warrior from the dead city

14.description: A captain leading Southron forces through Ithilien toward the Black Gate. Commands warriors from the far south who fight alongside Mordor's armies.
A warrior from the south who rides atop a great oliphaunt. Shows the exotic and formidable nature of the forces that Sauron has gathered from distant lands.

relationships.Mûmak: Rider and commander of the beast

20.description: A chieftain from the eastern lands of Khand who brings warriors to serve Sauron. Represents the far-reaching influence of the Dark Lord's power.
A captain from the eastern lands beyond the Sea of Rhûn who leads warriors in service to Mordor. Shows the extent of Sauron's alliances across Middle-earth.

relationships.Rhûn: Captain from lands beyond the sea
relationships.Sauron: Serves in the Dark Lord's armies

20.description: A captain of the Corsairs of Umbar who commands black ships sailing up the Anduin. Represents the naval power allied with Mordor from the southern havens.

12.description: One of the phantom faces seen in the Dead Marshes, appearing as a pale visage beneath the dark water. Represents the ancient dead from battles long ago.

13.description: Chief of the Nazgûl and most terrible of the Nine Ringbearers. Once the Witch-king of Angmar, he now serves as Sauron's most feared lieutenant and commander.

relationships.Nazgûl: Lord and commander of the Nine

13.description: One of the Nine Ringbearers who serves as lieutenant to the Witch-king. A fell spirit bound by one of the Nine Rings of power, now enslaved to Sauron's will.

relationships.Nine Rings: Bound by one of the rings

18.description: A monstrous flying creature that serves as mount for the Nazgûl. Neither bird nor bat, but a creature of shadow and malice bred for war and terror.

relationships.Mordor: Creature bred in the dark land

8.description: An orc who beats the war drums during the assault on Helm's Deep. Provides rhythm and coordination for the attacking forces, showing the organized nature of Saruman's army.

21.description: One of the lesser spiders that dwell in the tunnels of Cirith Ungol, offspring or kin to the great Shelob. Shows the infestation of evil creatures in the pass.

relationships.Mordor: Guards approaches to the dark land

12.description: An ancient evil spirit mentioned in connection with the dead and haunted places. Represents the lingering darkness in the lands between Gondor and Mordor.

13.description: The terrible aura of despair and fear that emanates from the Nazgûl. More than just terror, it is a supernatural dread that can break the will of even brave warriors.

16.description: The last High King of the Elves in Middle-earth who fell in the battle against Sauron. His name is remembered in songs and stories as a great leader who sacrificed himself for victory.

relationships.Elves: Last high king of the people

16.description: Founder of the realms of Arnor and Gondor, and father of Isildur. Died alongside Gil-galad in the final battle against Sauron, wielding the great sword Narsil.
Brother of Isildur and son of Elendil who helped found Gondor. Died defending Osgiliath during the siege by Sauron's forces in the Second Age.

14.description: The last king of Gondor who vanished when he accepted the Witch-king's challenge. His disappearance ended the line of kings and began the rule of the Stewards.

relationships.Denethor: Preceded by the line of Stewards
relationships.Minas Tirith: Final king of the white city

14.description: The first Ruling Steward of Gondor who took power after King Eärnur's disappearance. Founder of the line of Stewards that includes Denethor.

relationships.Gondor: First to rule in absence of kings

14.description: An ancestor of the Stewards known for his great hunting skills. His horn, made from the horn of one of the kine of Araw, was passed down through the line of Stewards.
An ancient Ranger of Ithilien remembered in the lore of Gondor. Represents the long tradition of Rangers defending the borders of the realm.

16.description: A king of Númenor remembered in the histories and songs of Gondor. Represents the ancient glory and power of the sea-kings from whom the Dúnedain are descended.
The Elven-smith who forged the Rings of Power with Sauron's aid, not knowing the Dark Lord's true purpose. His creation of the rings led to the current war.

relationships.Sauron: Deceived by the disguised Dark Lord
relationships.Three Rings: Secret maker of the greatest rings

4.description: The first of the Dwarf-fathers and founder of Khazad-dûm. His name is remembered in songs and his realm became the greatest of all Dwarf-kingdoms before its fall.

relationships.Dwarves: First and greatest of the fathers
relationships.Balrog: His realm fell to the demon

recaps.1: Boromir dies defending Merry and Pippin from Uruk-hai, but the hobbits are captured. Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli swear to pursue their captors and rescue their friends.
recaps.2: The Three Hunters pursue the Uruk-hai across Rohan. They encounter Éomer's company, who report destroying the orc-band but finding no hobbits among the dead.
recaps.3: The hunters find evidence that the hobbits escaped into Fangorn Forest during the battle. They enter the forest and encounter a mysterious old man they first mistake for Saruman.
recaps.4: The old man is revealed to be Gandalf, returned as Gandalf the White after his battle with the Balrog. Meanwhile, Merry and Pippin are rescued by Treebeard the Ent.
recaps.5: Gandalf reunites with Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli. He explains his death and resurrection, and his new role as head of the White Council. They ride to Edoras.
recaps.6: At Edoras, Gandalf breaks Saruman's spell over King Théoden, restoring the king's strength and will. Wormtongue is revealed as Saruman's spy and flees.
recaps.7: Théoden decides to lead his people to the ancient fortress of Helm's Deep for safety. The company rides to the stronghold as Saruman's army approaches.
recaps.8: The Battle of the Hornburg begins as Saruman's vast army of Uruk-hai assaults Helm's Deep. The fortress is besieged through the night with desperate fighting.
recaps.9: The battle reaches its climax as the fortress walls are breached. At dawn, Gandalf arrives with Erkenbrand and reinforcements, routing Saruman's army.
recaps.10: The Ents attack Isengard in their wrath over Saruman's destruction of the forests. Orthanc tower is surrounded by flood waters as the Ents dam the river.
recaps.11: Frodo and Sam capture Gollum, who has been following them. Despite Sam's misgivings, Frodo accepts Gollum's oath to guide them toward Mordor.
recaps.12: Gollum leads the hobbits through the Dead Marshes, where phantom faces of ancient warriors appear in the stagnant waters. They approach the Black Gate of Mordor.
recaps.13: Finding the Black Gate impregnable and heavily guarded, the hobbits allow Gollum to lead them by a secret way he knows. They head south toward Ithilien.
recaps.14: In Ithilien, Frodo and Sam witness a battle between Southrons and Rangers of Gondor. They are captured by Faramir, who reveals himself as Boromir's brother.
recaps.15: Faramir brings the hobbits to the hidden base of Henneth Annûn. Unlike his brother, he resists the temptation of the Ring and aids them on their mission.
recaps.16: Gandalf and the others parley with Saruman at Orthanc. Gandalf breaks Saruman's staff and casts him from the White Council. Wormtongue throws a palantír from the tower.
recaps.17: Pippin looks into the palantír and has a brief mental contact with Sauron himself. Gandalf takes the hobbit and rides swiftly toward Minas Tirith.
recaps.18: Aragorn reveals himself to Sauron through the palantír, challenging the Dark Lord and wresting control of the seeing-stone. He sees a fleet of black ships approaching.
recaps.19: Aragorn takes the Paths of the Dead with Legolas and Gimli, seeking to summon the oath-breaking dead to fulfill their ancient pledge.
recaps.20: The Dead follow Aragorn to the port of Pelargir, where they defeat the Corsairs. Aragorn releases them from their curse, and reinforcements from southern Gondor join him.
recaps.21: Faramir releases Frodo and Sam at the borders of Mordor. Gollum leads them to a secret entrance - the tunnel of Torech Ungol, lair of the giant spider Shelob.
